emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: Software that can autonomously code, debug, and deploy applications with minimal human oversight.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the need for human coders, shifts developer roles towards oversight and complex problem-solving, potential job displacement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires widespread acceptance in the tech industry, regulatory approval for critical systems, and overcoming trust issues with AI autonomy.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Link Technology
emerging_technologies.description: Implantable devices that enhance or restore human cognitive capabilities by connecting directly to the brain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ethical concerns around privacy, consent, and enhancement vs. therapy, potential for cognitive inequality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial cost, medical safety and ethical approval, public perception of brain-computer interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain systems designed to be secure against quantum computing attacks.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures long-term security for digital transactions and identity management, potential for new financial systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for standardization, global acceptance, and integration with existing blockchain networks.

emerging_technologies.name: Atmospheric Water Harvesting Tech
emerging_technologies.description: Devices that extract water from the atmosphere for use in water-scarce areas.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Helps combat water scarcity, supports sustainable living, potential to alleviate poverty.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Scalability, cost-effectiveness, integration with existing water infrastructure, and environmental impact.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Coding Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Now widely integrated into IDEs, these tools offer real-time coding suggestions, automated testing, and version control integration.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by software companies, becoming standard in developer tools, with continuous improvement in functionality.

mainstream_technologies.name: Self-Driving Public Transportation
mainstream_technologies.description: Autonomous buses and trains operating in urban and suburban areas.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: In major cities, with regulatory frameworks in place for safety, and public trust growing due to proven reliability.

epoch_themes.description: AI integration becomes ubiquitous, transforming traditional industries and daily life.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Changes in employment, education, and social structures; potential for significant economic disparities if not managed equitably.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, regulation, and education to prepare for an AI-centric world.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies aimed at reducing environmental impact and enhancing resource efficiency become mainstream.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes global sustainability, influences policy, consumer behavior, and corporate responsibility.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise in green technology investments, international cooperation for climate goals, and a push towards circular economies.
